question: How much weight will i lose if i..?
question_content:
I am currently walking/running 400 meters a day, doing 100 sit-ups and 20 push-ups. If i keep doing this every day until December 28th, how much weight will i lose? 
I am not fat, i just want to get rid of a little bit fat so my muscles really show up :)

answers.answer_content:
You can't out train a poor diet. Eating healthy, balanced while creating a calorie deficit based on your maintaince calorie needs is 80% of losing weight. Strength training is important because you'll lose lean muscle mass as you lose fat. Cardio comes in 3rd in importance.

3500 cals = approx 1lbs of fat.

If you are already in your healthy weight range you will only want to aim to lose 1/2 lbs/week. Anything more may cause your metabolism to slow and weightloss to come to a stand still as your body enters starvation mode.

Any strength training exercise you do, you should only be able to do 8-15 reps in a set before your muscle reach exhaustation (you can't do another rep in good form). If you can handle doing more than that in a set, you are not working your muscles hard enough to gain muscle and should be trying more challenging exercises or weights.
